/* Just politics */ It was solely in the city of St. Paul. Not in Minneapolis. They are, of course, entirely separate cities with separate city governments.
/* Heroic things */ This should be in quotes; it's the only way it makes sense. (Since they were Milk's words.) Otherwise it is really puzzling.
I'm going to be bold, and make this broader. Unless someone wants to cite that in the 1960s, traditional Irish families were flocking to B and O. More broad than that: San Bruno, Daly City, etc etc
/* Rise of Castro Street */ "suburbs in Berkeley and Oakland" makes no sense, not in the American use of the term "suburb" at least.
/* External links */
